NewsLine.NewsLineText: DIGEST:Reuters World News Digest at 1000 GMT, Sep 23

body.p: BERLIN - German Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder faces the task of reforming Europe's largest economy with a sharply reduced majority after he and his Greens coalition partners narrowly won Sunday's general election.
RAMALLAH - Israeli troops pressed on with their siege of Yasser Arafat's West Bank headquarters on Monday after halting demolition of his presidential complex following U.S. criticism.
BOUAKE - French troops rumbled north to evacuate Westerners trapped by fighting in Ivory Coast as skirmishes flared on Monday on the outskirts of a city where dozens of American children are hiding.

MERIDA, Mexico - Hurricane Isidore plowed across Mexico's Yucatan peninsula on Monday, forcing thousands from their homes as it flooded streets, toppled trees and power lines and shut down offshore oil rigs.
BAGHDAD - Iraq denounced on Monday as "wicked" U.S. attempts at the United Nations to adopt a tough resolution on Iraq's disarmament, saying Washington was seeking U.N. cover for any military action.

JAKARTA - A grenade exploded in a car outside a U.S. embassy warehouse in the centre of Indonesia's capital Jakarta on Monday in a botched attack that killed one of the vehicle's occupants, police said.

MADRID - Spain denied Moroccan claims that a Spanish military helicopter had landed on a disputed Mediterranean islet and said it regretted Rabat's cancellation of talks planned for Monday to smooth troubled relations.

SRINAGAR, India - Violence flared on Monday ahead of the second round of Indian Kashmir's state elections that Islamic militants have vowed to sabotage, as security forces gunned down four rebels, police said.

BRUSSELS - Germany emerged weakened from Sunday's general election and will need to move fast to salvage relations with the United States damaged by Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder's broadsides over Iraq, international analysts said.
KREMENSKAYA, Russia - Father Gennadi's mission is to save souls and shepherd strays back to God's flock.

LOS ANGELES - The Emmy awards played it safe on Sunday night, honoring an array of veteran shows, including "Friends" and "The West Wing," and effectively snubbing the season's hot new contender, "Six Feet Under."

TEHRAN - Iran has banned frog hunting after hundreds of locals in the north of the country rushed to trap the slippery amphibians spurred on by dealers from Turkey offering cash rewards, the Abrar daily said on Monday.
